data.title: I'm a former NBA champion but swapped basketball for startup investing in retirement and married a global sports star
data.meta_description: DAVID Lee has found both love and success in retirement since leaving the NBA.The two-time All-Star, 40, is married to Danish tennis playerÂ Caroline
data.text:
DAVID Lee has found both love and financial success since retiring from the NBA.

The two-time all-star, 40, is married to Danish tennis player Caroline Wozniacki.

Lee was the 30th overall pick in the 2005 NBA Draft by the New York Knicks.

He would spend five years at Madison Square Garden before joining the Golden State Warriors in 2010.

A dual-threat at 6-foot-9, Lee could operate at both center or power forward.

At his peak, he averaged over 20 points and 11 rebounds per game for the Warriors.

Lee became an NBA champion in 2015, despite his limited role with the Warriors that season.

He would retire two years later after spells with the Boston Celtics, Dallas Mavericks, and San Antonio Spurs.

Per Spotrac, Lee brought in a cool $92million during his NBA career.

And he immediately put that capital to good use after waving goodbye to basketball.

Lee worked for a year at Social Capital Investment in California before becoming a director in Florida in 2018.

He took up the role at new startup Topsail Re, a privately held reinsurance company.

According to the company's LinkedIn page, it boasts over 1,000 employees.

Its mission is to "partner with Insurance Companies in which our expertise and capital can make a difference."

It continues: "Our goal is to simplify the reinsurance process for all parties and provide a stable long-term platform for our Partners."

Away from the court, Lee found romance with Wozniacki after meeting the tennis ace at a dinner party in 2015.

They hit it off immediately, with the pair getting engaged two years later during a vacation to Bora Bora.

Wozniacki wrote on Instagram: "Happiest day of my life yesterday saying yes to my soulmate."

The loved-up couple married in 2019 and have two young children, Olivia and James.
